alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 4:55AM AKST until December 27 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Freezing rain and Snow expected. Ice accumulations up to one quarter of an inch. Snow accumulations up to 3 inches, mainly northeast of Palmer. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel will be hazardous. Ice accumulation may cause downed power lines and falling tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop early this morning and quickly transition to freezing rain across much of the Matanuska Valley. There may be a brief break in precipitation late this morning before steadier and heavier freezing rain moves back in this afternoon and persists into the evening. Air temperatures may rise above freezing by this evening, but rain will continue to fall on snow and ice covered roads, which can be just as hazardous as freezing rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
